SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com4j
Class Variant

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Number
      com4j.Variant
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Variant
extends Number

Wraps COM VARIANT data structure.

This class allows you to deal with the raw VARIANT type in case you need it, but in general you should bind VARIANT* to Object or Holder<Object> for more natural Java binding.

Notes

  1. Calling methods defined on Number changes the variant type (i.e., similar to a cast in Java) accordingly and returns its value.

Method names that end with '0' are native methods.

Author:
Kohsuke Kawaguchi (kk@kohsuke.org), Michael Schnell (ScM, (C) 2008, 2009, Michael-Schnell@gmx.de)
See Also:

Field Detail

MISSING

public static final Variant MISSING
Deprecated. This constant instance is mutable (both by Java methods and COM code where this gets passed into as a reference), so it's fundamentally unsafe. use getMissing() instead.
Represents the special variant instance used for missing parameters.

Constructor Detail

Variant

public Variant()
Creates an empty Variant.

Variant

public Variant(Variant.Type type)
Creates an empty Variant with the given type.

Parameters:
type - The type of the new Variant.
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Empties the current contents.

Sometimes a Variant holds things like interface pointers or arrays, which require some clean up actions. Therefore, when you want to reuse an existing Variant that may hold a value, you should first clear it.

finalize

public void finalize()
Makes sure the variant is cleared before GC-ed.

Overrides:
finalize in class Object

get

public Object get()
Retrieves the current contents of the Variant and returns an object. The type of the object depends on the type of the Variant.

Returns:
The current value.
See Also:
set0(Object, ByteBuffer)

getParseableString

public String getParseableString()
Generates an String representation of this Variant that can be parsed.

Returns:
A parsable String representation of this Variant

getJavaCode

public String getJavaCode()
Returns a Java literal as a String of this Variant

For example, if the Variant is of the type VT_R4 and its value is 4.6, then the Java literal is "4.6f".

Returns:
The Java literal.

object

public <T extends Com4jObject> T object(Class<T> type)
Reads this VARIANT as a COM interface pointer.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the return value
Parameters:
type - The class object of the type
Returns:
The Com4jObject of the IUnknown interface pointer that this Variant represents.

getMissing

public static Variant getMissing()
Generates a new Variant object, representing the VARIANT MISSING

Returns:
A new instance of the MISSING variant.

isMissing

public boolean isMissing()
Tests if this Variant represents the VARIANT MISSING

Returns:
true if this Variant represents MISSING, false otherwise.

toString

public String toString()
Returns a String representation of this Variant

A Variant consists of 16 bytes in memory. The String representation of a Variant is a sequence of 16 bytes in hex

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
The hexadecimal value of the ByteBuffer of this Variant
